intro: Strobilanthes capitata var. nitida, commonly known as the silver strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is noted for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage. This variant is distinguished by its finely textured leaves and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
